intro: Tetranema michaelfayanum, commonly known as the Michael Fayan plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, woody stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a glossy surface. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom in clusters, making it an ornamental plant in some horticultural settings.
